Based on the definition here "https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/os-release.5.html " Os-release includes the keyword mentioned the document. Looks like the new keyword introduced here is not part of the documentation. 
Approach should be introduce new plugin to collected the required info, and user can include this new plugin based on the usecase.
Acknowledged
change --> dreport: Adding backup and min FW info in BMC dumps
Acknowledged
Btter to rephrase this message to support additional information. instead "support"
Acknowledged
Please remove org related data from the commit message.
Acknowledged
Code looks good to me.

This looks like plugin type function. Move this to Plugin code. 
It will be better to new plugin to support additional firmware details.
Acknowledged
Move this in separate script and add the details os-release file only for IBM specific dumps.
Acknowledged
This plugin is used for
Acknowledged

This is related to IBM specific dumps? If yes, then this function will be called for obmc dumps as well which should not happen.
Also if its specific to IBM only please create a separate script and place it in ibm.d dir
Acknowledged
Review comments addressed. Kindly review again.
Do we need this in all dumps or just user requested dumps?
In the defect it is mentioned as "captured in all BMC dumps" so had put all
That needs to be confirmed, smaller and quicker dumps like core dump may not need this
Ok asked the reporter to clarify

PE confirmed that it is for all dumps

Joe Mulholland
:spiral_calendar_pad:  5:31 PM
we should get the fw level info for every bmc dump
5:31
( and so, backup as well )
Start with user initiated dump now. Not required for others unless there is strong reason for adding this from debug point.
Acknowledged
return silently?

Yes, because the backup FW is not a necessity or compulsory. So if a system doesn't have a backup FW then the PE may be informed about it but shouldn't cause any disruption/failure/error marking in dump collection
trace also may not be needed, just continue if possible
Acknowledged
return silently?

Yes, because the backup FW is not a necessity or compulsory. So if a system doesn't have a backup FW then the PE may be informed about it but shouldn't cause any disruption/failure/error marking in dump collection
I mean that log may not be needed
Acknowledged
declare these constants outside for better readability?

I would rather prefer to keep these as the local to the function for now for the below reasons

1) These are only been used by the function alone as of now. If in future we add more use cases then definitely we can take them out of function scope.

2) As we returning early on failure thus declaring those in file scope would be meaningless in case there is some error

3) By the rule of "declare where you use them" it is better to have them near of theirs uses as much as possible.
I agree there is only one function, but declaring this outside will improve the redability
Acknowledged
return silently?

Yes, because the backup FW is not a necessity or compulsory. So if a system doesn't have a backup FW then the PE may be informed about it but shouldn't cause any disruption/failure/error marking in dump collection
This log can be avoided
Acknowledged
else may not be needed
Acknowledged
use xargs to remove space?
I would rather prefer to stick to sed as it is been already tested for multiple scenarios.
xargs also tested, and that will remove the need for this long line with sed for just removing space
Acknowledged
may not be needed
Acknowledged
return silently?

Yes, because the backup FW is not a necessity or compulsory. So if a system doesn't have a backup FW then the PE may be informed about it but shouldn't cause any disruption/failure/error marking in dump collection
trace also may nit be needed
Acknowledged
Kindly review as comments addressed wherever feasible.

This function layout is not aligned to dreport plugin standard. use api's provided in tools/dreport.d/include.d/functions , to run the commands and to collect out put. refer any of the existing script for more info.

Hi @jayanth, the add_cmd_output in tools/dreport.d/include.d/functions only adds the command O/P to a file. Here, in this case, it is not simply writing a command's O/P to the file but it requires a lot of processing before that.

One thing I can think of is to move this function itself to tools/dreport.d/include.d/functions file and then calling that as done in case of other plugins. Kindly advice.

Refer this plugin , tools/dreport.d/plugins.d/ldapdump 

Basically you need to use standard functions to support dreport way of packaging and validations.
Acknowledged
This checking is not required. dreport script sets this path initially before plugin execution.
Acknowledged
Please review
Changed as suggested
is this information included in this commit?
Doesn't seem it is so probably can be removed from the commit title.
Acknowledged

The alternate (non-running) version information is a common D-Bus and Redfish property that's also displayed in the GUI, not IBM-specific, so it could be included in the common plugin data.
The full non-running os-release file would require a bit more work (mounting the alternate filesystem), so probably we can just add the version string, but I agree it should be added in a separate file because like Jayanth mentions it's not accurate to add an arbitrary field to the os-release file, it could confuse the users.
Acknowledged
why this defined in global scope?
Acknowledged
Any specific reason fro adding this code as part of function instead follwo the way other plugin implemention?
Remove the function thing but the line of commands are necessary to process the O/P properly
Done
use redudant instead of backup looks better.
Acknowledged
this assumption is for two version of the mage supported right? Code update maintainers can comment on how to make this logic generic.
Seems like with the 'dbus_tree_command' command above that it's being checked if more than one image is present.
It verifies first if there is a redundant image available at all and then only proceeds
Done

Plugin usually follows at beginning of the files. Try to follow this format if possible like, use variable definition same below. 

Adding these two definition at beginning and other at definition at appropriate places in your s cript.
desc="Backup firmware info"  
file_name="os-release"

::

command=" :"
add_cmd_output "
Acknowledged

add_cmd_output() function deletd the os-release file incase of any internal failure. This could delete the existing os-relase file.Please consider this error case correctly.
What is the expectation here? appending os-release or getting this info in new file?
Not applicable anymore as the os-release file is not been amended anymore by the redundant OS string
Done
is this still valid?
Yes.

where is priority check happening?
Between LN50 to LN59
Done

Is this error case? 
"No redundant FW available" or "failed to get redundant FW" information?
Acknowledged
still showing same message. question , Looks like this is error condition, like to fail to get fw details?

Yes, as it might be possible that there is no redundant OS available due to either got deleted manually (for some dev purposes/testing) or doesn't have a policy of redundant OS at all. So just informing the user as was done in other plugin cases
column >80
Acknowledged
